• Adaptive SC-FEM Approximation
  • Curriculum Vitae

Benjamin M. Kent

I am a final year PhD student in the Department of Mathematics at The University of Manchester. My research is into the numerical analysis and a posteriori error estimation of adaptive approximations to parametric partial differential equations.

My supervisors are Professor Catherine Powell and Professor David Silvester. My PhD is an iCASE sponsored project with IBM Research UK.

Prior to my PhD, I attended The University of Warwick. I recieved a First-Class Honours BSc in Mathematics and Physics BSc.

I also worked for four years at the multi-national engineering company Thales UK.
